Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Styelin A (natural AMPs; tunicate, marine  invertebrates, animals; XXA; VIHNN)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: purified by a five-step procedure consisting of acid extraction, ultrafiltration, preparative electrophoresis, and two cycles of reverse phase HPLC.Activity: killed E. coli (MIC 1-2 ug/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC 1-2 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 1-2 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 3 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes (MIC 1 ug/ml), vancomycin-resistant strain (anti-VRE) of E. faecium (MIC 1 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC ~36 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: Also active against marine bacteria P. immobilis and P. citreus in the presence of 0.3 M NaCl. NaCl-insensitive:P. immobilis (300 mM) and NaCl-insensitive:P. citreus (300 mM).Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Lee IH, Cho Y, Lehrer RI.1997
Literature Information.Title: Styelins, broad-spectrum antimicrobial peptides from the solitary tunicate, Styela clava.
